conclusion: Analyze forces and use Newton's second law.
Horizontal pulling force F applied to block B, spring force Fs between B and C, static friction on D.
No friction between blocks and surface; all blocks accelerate with same acceleration a.
Using Newton's second law: F = 4ma, so a = F/4m.
Block D influenced by static friction force fs from block C.
Static friction fs responsible for acceleration of block D: fs = ma.
Magnitude of static friction force on block D is F/4.
